programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.desc: Begin your tour of treasures from the Smithsonian with the artifact that inspired our national anthem.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.sub-title: Presidents and Generals - Images of Leadership
programme.desc: Learn how some of the country's greatest leaders have seen themselves and been seen by the nation.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.desc: View Smithsonian artifacts that tell the story of the quest for religious freedom in America.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.sub-title: The Growth and Spread of Slavery
programme.desc: Starting with a set of slave shackles, chart the history of slavery in the Americas.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.desc: Study relics and documents related to the emancipation of slaves during the Civil War era.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.sub-title: Gold, Guns, and Grandeur - The West
programme.desc: Hear the tale told by a tiny gold flake which launched the California Gold Rush in the late 1840s.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.sub-title: The First Americans - Then and Now
programme.desc: Inspect stone points produced at the end of the last ice age by early hunter-gatherers in the Americas.

programme.desc: In this episode, examine four key artifacts that tell the story of America on the move.

programme.title: Ancient Civilizations of North America
programme.sub-title: The Unknown Story of Ancient North America
programme.desc: We are finally able to reveal the fascinating truths about ancient North America.

programme.title: Ancient Civilizations of North America
programme.sub-title: The First Human Migrations to the Americas
programme.desc: DNA evidence points to Asia as the origin of all human migration to North America.

programme.title: Ancient Civilizations of North America
programme.desc: Explore Clovis, the very first American culture.

programme.title: Ancient Civilizations of North America
programme.desc: Better understand why some Paleo-Indian groups developed hunting and gathering culture.

programme.title: Ancient Civilizations of North America
programme.desc: See how, peoples of North America developed corn agriculture, permanent houses and metallurgy.

programme.title: Ancient Civilizations of North America
programme.sub-title: Poverty Point: North America's First City
programme.desc: While most North Americans were nomadic, see how a group of ancient people developed a planned community.

programme.title: Maya to Aztec: Ancient Mesoamerica Revealed
programme.desc: Dr. Barnhart takes you on a whirlwind tour of important places, civilizations, and events in Mesoamerica.

programme.title: Maya to Aztec: Ancient Mesoamerica Revealed
programme.desc: Here, hear how the Olmec were discovered, and investigate three intriguing sites where they lived.

programme.title: Maya to Aztec: Ancient Mesoamerica Revealed
programme.sub-title: Olmec Art as the Mother Culture
programme.desc: Delve into Olmec art, searching for clues to who the Olmec were and what preoccupied these builders.
